title.narrative: 6.12 OPERATIONS COVID-19 RESPONSE

description.narrative: 106/012 Governments and partners have increased capacity to provide continued access to Operations services and critical supplies for women and children for strengthening Infection Prevention and Control and for suppressing the COVID-19 transmission at community level, which contributes to Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Operations Support To Programme Delivery (Covid), Supply And Logistics, Supply And Logistics (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 6. By 2022, children and women have equitable access to knowledge and services related to COVID-19 prevention and treatment in the areas of health, nutrition, education, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) and child protection in the most deprived areas, including Rohingya refugee camps.

sector.narrative: CO/RO Supply - technical assistance and collaboration in supply chain, procurement of goods and services, and logistics

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 106/012 Governments and partners have increased capacity to provide continued access to Operations services and critical suppliesfor women and children for strengthening Infection Prevention and Control and for suppressing the COVID-19 transmission atcommunity level

description.narrative: In addition to the support provided to the Government of Bangladesh in ensuring availability of COVID-19 vaccines through;the;COVAX vaccine roll-out initiative, the office played;a;leading role;as;logistics focal point for the UN vaccination programme which included;the transportation, storage and distribution of the;initial;allocation;of 1,900 doses of Johnson;&;Johnson;vaccines;to the sites. This UN vaccination programme was rolled out for;ensuring the availability of;the;vaccine to UN and international NGOs;personnel. UNICEF was represented in the Local Vaccine Deployment Team. | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2021
